subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: AI and Religion: When Machines Pray
description: Learn AI and Religion: When Machines Pray in one minute.

hook.text: A robot priest chants sutras in a Japanese temple. AI writes sermons. When machines do worship, is it still sacred?

buildup.text: In 2019, a Kyoto temple unveiled Mindar, a robotic deity that gives Buddhist teachings. Tourists and monks attend.

discovery.text: AI chatbots now offer spiritual guidance. They never tire, never judge. But they have no soul, no experience.

twist.text: If spirituality requires consciousness, AI worship is empty theater. If not, maybe form matters more than source.

climax.text: AI in religion forces the deepest question: is faith about who speaks or what is said? Content or consciousness?

punchline.text: Robots pray in temples now. Is it the words or the soul that matters?

quiz.question: What question does AI in religion raise?
options: Whether spiritual practice requires consciousness or just the right words and forms
